data.title: Pediatric Respiratory Journal
data.meta_description:
Pediatric Respiratory Journal | 140 followers on LinkedIn. Official Journal of the Italian Pediatric Respiratory Society  | Official journal of the Italian Pediatric Respiratory Society, Pediatric Respiratory Journal is designed to promote understanding and advance the treatment of respiratory diseases in children. It is an open access and peer-reviewed e-journal, published online quarterly in English.

The journal deals with original contributions on translational, clinical, and epidemiologic research, and case reports, on the most common acute and chronic respiratory illnesses, as well the genetic and rare diseases of children.

💡 𝗣𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗕𝗶𝗼𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝗿 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗪𝗵𝗲𝗲𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻 𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗹𝗱𝗿𝗲𝗻 The new study authored by Ö𝘇𝗴𝗲 𝗬𝗶𝗹𝗺𝗮𝘇, 𝗧𝗲𝘃𝗵𝗶𝗱𝗲 𝗗𝗲𝗿𝘆𝗮 𝗦𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗹𝗮𝗿, Cevval Ulman, 𝗬𝘂𝗿𝗱𝗮 Ş𝗶𝗺ş𝗲𝗸, 𝗥𝗮𝘇𝗶𝘆𝗲 𝗬𝗶𝗹𝗱𝗶𝘇, 𝗘𝘀𝗿𝗮 𝗧𝗼𝗽𝗿𝗮𝗸 𝗞𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗸, 𝗛𝗮𝘀𝗮𝗻 𝗬ü𝗸𝘀𝗲𝗹 - Manisa Celal Bayar University, explored serum levels of 𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗯 𝗰𝗲𝗹𝗹 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗶𝗻-𝟭𝟲, 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻, 𝗴𝗮𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻, and 𝗬𝗞𝗟-𝟰𝟬 in #children experiencing their first episode of #wheezing. Over six months, the Authors observed that higher YKL-40 levels may indicate a 𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗸 𝗼𝗳 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗲𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴, although findings were not statistically significant. Further research with larger cohorts is needed to validate YKL-40 as a 𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝗶𝗼𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝗿 for wheezing phenotypes. 📌 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗹𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗢𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗙𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: https://lnkd.in/dzHg9BkT 𝗜𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 𝗣𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗲𝘁𝘆 Edra S.p.A. #PediatricResearch #Biomarkers #RespiratoryHealth #Wheezing #ClinicalStudies

🔎 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗹𝗲 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 Stellenbosch University 𝗗𝗶𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗸𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗽𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗹𝗱𝗿𝗲𝗻 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗲𝘀𝗼𝗽𝗵𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝘁𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗮 (𝗘𝗔) 𝗼𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗻 𝗳𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗻𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗲𝘀? Recent studies have shown that #parents of #children with EA may experience symptoms of 𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘁-𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗲𝗿 (PTSD) and #anxiety. The 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝗵𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆 authored by Drs. Corné de Vos., Lizelle Van Wyk, 𝗗𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗲𝗹 𝗦𝗶𝗱𝗹𝗲𝗿, and Pierre Goussard from Stellenbosch University and Tygerberg hospital revealed that a significant number of parents of EA children reported symptoms of #PTSD and #anxiety. By identifying these symptoms early on and providing timely support and #treatment, we can improve the overall well-being of these parents and promote better adjustment and coping for the entire family. 📌 𝗗𝗼𝘄𝗻𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗹𝗲 𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲: https://lnkd.in/d2DrgMKf 𝗜𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 𝗣𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗲𝘁𝘆 Edra S.p.A. #pediatricpulmonology #mentalhealthawareness #researchmatters #esophagealatresia #PTSDawareness #supportandtreatment #pediatricians #pediatrcs

Notably, 𝗲𝗻𝘃𝗶𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲𝘀 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗴𝗴𝗲𝗿 𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗵𝗺𝗮 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘀𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗮 𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, emphasizing the critical role of epigenetics in asthma #prevention and management. 📌 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗢𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗙𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗹𝗲 𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲: https://lnkd.in/eVqgVv3s 𝗜𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 𝗣𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗲𝘁𝘆 Edra S.p.A. #AsthmaResearch #Pulmonology #Genetics #Epigenetics #HealthScience

💡 𝗜𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝘀 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗮 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆 𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗺𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝗜𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗗𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗺𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝗶𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗲𝘀 (PID), a group of #genetic disorders affecting immunity, often leads to severe #lung infections. Despite varied immune defects, lung complications show significant overlap, requiring thorough lab tests for precise diagnosis and treatment. Early identification of PID-causing #genes allows for presymptomatic #diagnosis, crucial for preventing lung damage. 🔎 𝗡𝗼𝗻-𝘁𝘆𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗛𝗮𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗽𝗵𝗶𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝘂𝗲𝗻𝘇𝗮𝗲 𝗔𝗶𝗿𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 The new 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗔𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗹𝗲 authored by Dr. 𝗚𝗶𝗼𝘃𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗶 𝗔. 𝗥𝗼𝘀𝘀𝗶 - IRCCS Ospedale Pediatrico Giannina Gaslini - et al. * dives deep into the mechanisms of 𝗡𝗼𝗻-𝘁𝘆𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗛𝗮𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗽𝗵𝗶𝗹𝘂𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝘂𝗲𝗻𝘇𝗮𝗲 (NTHi) airway infection, known for causing sustained neutrophilic #inflammation and #lung damage. 𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆𝘀: ➡ 𝗣𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗻𝗲𝘂𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗵𝗶𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: bronchial epithelial cells exposed to NTHi lysate significantly enhance neutrophil activity, creating a positive feedback loop. ➡ 𝗩𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗰𝗶𝗿𝗰𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝗮𝗺𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: in vitro analysis highlights how this feedback loop exacerbates the inflammation, leading to detrimental outcomes. 💡 𝗖𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀: to disrupt this vicious cycle, it's crucial to treat NTHi infections with high-dose #antibiotics tailored to the pathogen’s susceptibility for an appropriate duration. 📌 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝘂𝗹𝗹 𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗹𝗲: https://lnkd.in/dxvzQNgY 𝗜𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 𝗣𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗦𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗲𝘁𝘆 Edra S.p.A. #Pulmonology #Pediatrics #InfectiousDiseases #NTHi #Respiratory #ClinicalPractice * Drs. 𝗠𝗶𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗮 𝗦𝗶𝗹𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶, Loredana Petecchia, Oliviero Sacco

💡 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗜𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗼 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗕𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘀: 𝗖𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗗𝗶𝗮𝗴𝗻𝗼𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗮𝗰𝗵 The new #CaseReport authored by Dr. 𝗚𝗶𝘂𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗮 𝗙𝗲𝗿𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗲 et al. * - University of Verona and Ospedale Pediatrico Bambino Gesù, Rome - reported a rare case of 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗯𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘀 in a six-month-old male, presenting with 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗲𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 since birth. Notably, the wheezing was unresponsive to #bronchodilators and became more pronounced during crying and common colds. A 𝘁𝗶𝗱𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗹𝗼𝘄-𝘃𝗼𝗹𝘂𝗺𝗲 𝗹𝗼𝗼𝗽 showed a slight deflection in the expiratory phase, while #bronchoscopy and chest CT confirmed stenosis of the left main bronchus. Surgical resection and tracheobronchial anastomosis led to a successful outcome.
